org.parboiled
Interface Context<V>

Type Parameters:
V - the type of the value field of a parse tree node
All Known Implementing Classes:
MatcherContext
public interface Context<V>

A Context object is available to parser actions methods during their runtime and provides various support functionality.

Method Summary

          Returns the current location in the input buffer.

          Returns the InputBuffer the parser is currently running against

Returns:

getNodeChar

Returns the first input character matched by the given node.

Parameters:
node - the node
Returns:
null if node is null or did not match at least one character otherwise the first matched input char

getNodeByPath

Node<V> getNodeByPath(String path)

Returns the first node that matches the given path. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) )} for a description of the path argument.

Caution: Be aware of the current state of the parse tree when calling this method. You can only reference nodes that have already been created. Since parse tree nodes are immutable they are only created when their complete subtrees are fully determined. This means that all parent nodes have not yet been created when you call this method. Note that you can still access the value objects of future parent nodes through the getParent() chain.

Parameters:
path - the path to the node being searched for
Returns:
the node if found or null if not found

getNodeByLabel

Node<V> getNodeByLabel(String labelPrefix)

Returns the first node that matches the given labelPrefix.

Caution: Be aware of the current state of the parse tree when calling this method. You can only reference nodes that have already been created. Since parse tree nodes are immutable they are only created when their complete subtrees are fully determined. This means that all parent nodes have not yet been created when you call this method. Note that you can still access the value objects of future parent nodes through the getParent() chain.

Parameters:
labelPrefix - the label prefix to search for
Returns:
the node if found or null if not found

getLastNode

Node<V> getLastNode()
Returns the last node created during this parsing run. The last node is independent from the current context scope, i.e. all context along the context chain would return the same object at any given point in the parsing process.

Returns:
the last node created during this parsing run.

setNodeValue

void setNodeValue(V value)
Sets the value object of the node to be created at the current context scope.

Parameters:
value - the object

getNodeValue

V getNodeValue()
Returns the previously set value of the node to be created at the current context scope.

Returns:
the previously set value

getTreeValue

V getTreeValue()
If this context has an explicitly set node value (see setNodeValue(Object)) it is returned. Otherwise the method return the last non-null value of the already created subnodes.

Returns:
a node value or null

getSubNodes

List<Node<V>> getSubNodes()
Returns the parse tree subnodes already created in the current context scope.

Returns:
the parse tree subnodes already created in the current context scope
